history.proof: intros z Hz. destruct Hz as [k Hz]. rewrite Hz. apply Zodd_2p_plus_1.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall z : Z, (exists k : Z, z = Z.add (Z.mul 2 k) 1) -> Zodd z

Premises:
Zodd = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 | Z.pos (_~0)%positive | Z.neg (_~0)%positive => False | _ => True end : Z -> Prop Arguments Zodd _%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Zeven_def2 : forall z : Z, (exists k : Z, z = 2 * k) -> Zeven z
Zodd_def1 : forall z : Z, Zodd z -> exists k : Z, z = 2 * k + 1
Zodd_ex_iff : forall n : Z, Zodd n < -> (exists m : Z, n = 2 * m + 1)
sqr_0 : forall z : Z, z * z = 0 -> z = 0
Zodd_equiv : forall z : Z, Zodd z < -> Z.Odd z
OMEGA5 : forall x y z : Z, x = 0 -> y = 0 -> x + y * z = 0
OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, 0 <= x -> y = 0 -> 0 <= x + y * z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.pos p)) -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.neg p)) -> forall z : Z, P z
fast_OMEGA16 : forall (v c l k : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c * k) + l * k) -> P ((v * c + l) * k)
OMEGA20 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
OMEGA17 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
tech_up : forall (r : R) (z : Z), (r < IZR z)%R -> (IZR z <= r + 1)%R -> z = up r
up_tech : forall (r : R) (z : Z), (IZR z <= r)%R -> (r < IZR (z + 1))%R -> z + 1 = up r
QArith_base.Qle_lt_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qlt y z -> QArith_base.Qlt x z
QArith_base.Qle_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qle y z -> QArith_base.Qle x z
Zodd_ex : forall n : Z, Zodd n -> exists m : Z, n = 2 * m + 1
OMEGA3 : forall x y k : Z, k > 0 -> x = y * k -> x = 0 -> y = 0
QArith_base.Qmult_le_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} z -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult z x) (QArith_base.Qmult z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
Zodd_div2 : forall n : Z, Zodd n -> n = 2 * Z.div2 n + 1
Zodd_quot2_neg : forall n : Z, n <= 0 -> Zodd n -> n = 2 * Z.quot2 n - 1
Zodd_quot2 : forall n : Z, n >= 0 -> Zodd n -> n = 2 * Z.quot2 n + 1
OMEGA18 : forall x y k : Z, x = y * k -> Zne x 0 -> Zne y 0
Zodd_2p_plus_1 : forall p : Z, Zodd (2 * p + 1)
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos p => Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0%nat end : Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qplus_le_r : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus z x) (QArith_base.Qplus z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y

```coq
intros z Hz.
destruct Hz as [k Hz].
rewrite Hz.
apply Zodd_2p_plus_1.
Qed.```
